business.headline: Samvat 2082: Top stocks and sectors to bet on for the new yearIndia's macroeconomic fundamentals remain firm. Global rating agency S&P recently upgraded India's credit outlook, while the International Monetary Fund (IMF) raised its GDP forecast.

Curious case of RRP Semiconductor: The stock that gained 63,000% in 18 monthsRRP Semiconductor's stock soared from Rs 15 to Rs 9,478 in just 18 months, stunning Dalal Street. But do the company's financials really justify this meteoric rise?

Waaree Energies shares jump 50% in a year: More upside left in the stock?The company's Q2 FY26 results were strong across all key metrics. Waaree Energies reported a 132.97% year-on-year jump in consolidated net profit to Rs 871.21 crore in the September 2025 quarter, compared to Rs 375.66 crore a year ago.

Will gold, silver prices fall in India tomorrow as global rates crash?Global gold and silver have cooled after historic gains, while MCX remains closed. Will Indian investors face similar declines tomorrow, or is this a buying opportunity? Read on to find out.

US likely to cut tariffs on Indian imports to 15%-16%: ReportThe proposed agreement mainly focusses on the energy and agriculture sectors. One of the key elements under discussion is India's gradual reduction of crude oil imports from Russia, a move that aligns with Washington's efforts to limit global dependence on Russian energy supplies.

Samvat 2082: 15 high-conviction stock ideas amid ongoing market rallyAnalysts see higher returns ahead as Dalal Street enters Samvat 2082. Check out Choice Broking's top 15 stock picks span defence, tech, and premium consumption.

BSE, NSE holiday: Is stock market open or closed for trading today?The stock market was closed on Tuesday on account of Diwali and only two more holidays remain this year. One for Guru Nanank Jayanti on November 05 and the other for Christmas, December 25.

Gold, silver prices fall: Is the bullion rally ending?Gold prices have gained nearly 56% this year due to strong demand from central banks, ongoing geopolitical tensions, and rising expectations of rate cuts by major central banks.

Muhurat Trading ends in green; Cipla, Bajaj Finserv among top gainersThe BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty50 both closed in the green, led by gains in Cipla and Bajaj Finserv, even as mid-session profit booking trimmed early advances.

Samvat 2082: Experts see new highs, bet on domestic sectorsFor investors, Bandyopadhyay recommends focusing on domestic growth stories. "Cement, infrastructure, construction, and capital goods will lead the charge," he noted, highlighting Ultratech Cement, L&T, and Bharti Airtel as top picks.

Muhurat Trading 2025: Sensex, Nifty dip after strong opening; Infosys up 1%The BSE Sensex rose 180.76 points, or 0.21%, to 84,544.13, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 62.60 points, or 0.24%, to 25,905.75 at 1:50 pm.
How to make the most of your Diwali bonus and build long-term wealthTurn your Diwali bonus into a stepping stone for long-term financial security with these expert-backed tips.

Gold hits Rs 1.30 lakh again, silver at Rs 1.58 lakh: Buy now or wait for a dip?Gold and silver are regaining momentum amid festive demand and global uncertainty. Investors should buy with discipline, stagger purchases, and treat bullion as a long-term hedge rather than chasing short-term spikes.

Muhurat Trading today: Your quick guide to today's one-hour special sessionAs Muhurat Trading 2025 begins this afternoon, optimism runs high on Dalal Street. With Nifty near record highs and liquidity improving, experts suggest discipline, stock selection, and long-term focus.

Sensex, Nifty end higher on Diwali as Reliance, bank stocks shineThe BSE Sensex rose 0.5% to 84,363.37, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 0.49% to 25,851—both hitting fresh one-year highs. Over the past four sessions, the indices have climbed 2.8%, leaving them less than 2% away from their all-time highs scaled in September 2024.

China files WTO complaint against India over EV subsidies and batteriesThe Chinese Commerce Ministry has alleged that the measures by India violate several WTO obligations, including the principle of national treatment, and constitute import substitution subsidies, which are explicitly prohibited under the multi-lateral trade rules.

Muhurat Trading on October 21: Check timing, trade strategy and moreMuhurat Trading will take place on October 21 this year. The pre-open session will run from 1:30 pm to 1:45 pm, followed by the main trading window from 1:45 pm to 2:45 pm, and a closing session until 3:05 pm.

Reliance shares jump 3% after Q2 results. Should it be in your Diwali portfolio?Around 10:20 am, shares of Reliance Industries rose 3.22% to Rs 1,462.60 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The stock's sharp upmove added to the broader market rally on Dalal Street as sentiment turned upbeat following a string of solid earnings reports.

Diwali cheer on Dalal Street as Sensex jumps nearly 700 pointsAt around 9:23 am, the S&P BSE Sensex jumped 673.90 points to 84,626.09, while the NSE Nifty50 surged 202.50 points to 25,912.35. Broader market indices also witnessed sharp gains, and volatility dropped, indicating strong investor confidence.

Silver prices fall after Diwali buying. Is it still a good bet?Silver has surged nearly 98% in a year, breaching Rs 2 lakh/kg in parts of India before a post-Diwali dip. But is investing in the precious metal still a good bet? With industrial demand booming and supply tightening, reports suggest silver's shine might just be getting started.

entertainment.headline: Ayushmann Khurrana offers prayers at Siddhivinayak after Thamma's Diwali success Ayushmann Khurrana visited Mumbai's Siddhivinayak Temple to seek blessings after his film 'Thamma' emerged as a major hit in the Maddock horror-comedy universe. The film's unique love story and strong cast have struck a chord with audiences, marking a big win for both the actor and the franchise.

Thamma ending explained: How Betaal vs Betaal fight sets the stage for greater war Ayushmann Khurrana's 'Thamma' ends with a fierce Betaal vs Betaal showdown, something the trailer had also teased. But the final twist hints at a much larger conflict brewing within Maddock's horror-comedy universe.

Bigg Boss Kannada 12: Wildcard entrants stir chaos among contestants The twelfth season of Bigg Boss Kannada introduced a major twist at the end of three weeks with three wild card contestants, Mutant Raghu, Risha Gowda and Suraj Singh, entering the house.

Pooja Ruparel on 30 years of DDLJ: Kajol was like elder sister, SRK true prince Actor Pooja Ruparel spoke to India Today about her experience on the sets of 'Dilwale Dulhaniya Le Jayenge'. Starring Shah Rukh Khan and Kajol, the film completed 30 years of release on October 20.

Bestest mommy in town: Raghav Chadha wishes Parineeti with baby bump pics Politician Raghav Chadha extended birthday greetings to his actor-wife Parineeti Chopra with an adorable post on Instagram. The couple recently welcomed a baby boy.

Jr NTR and I trusted YRF, but it misfired: Telugu distributor Naga Vamsi on War 2 Telugu producer Naga Vamsi, who distributed the Telugu version of 'War 2', reflected on the film's underperformance and his trust in YRF. 'War 2', starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR, faced box office disappointment despite a strong opening.

Kajol's Diwali post celebrates life's cycle, family and new beginnings Actor Kajol shared a Diwali post about the cycle of life and new beginnings. She celebrated the festival with her family, including Ajay Devgn and their children.

Rishab Shetty plans crisper English version for Kantara Chapter 1 globally Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara Chapter 1' gears up for a global English release on October 31 with a crisper cut tailored for international audiences.
Lucky Ali slams Javed Akhtar for 'don't become like Muslims' remark Singer Lucky Ali has responded to Javed Akhtar after a video surfaced of Akhtar telling Hindus not to become like Muslims

AI pics of Squid Game actor Lee Jung Jae used to scam woman of 500 million KRW Woman in her 50s loses approximately 350,000 USD in an online impersonation scam involving fake AI-generated photos and social media communications claiming to be from Squid Game star Lee Jung Jae.

Ayushmann Khurrana: Thamma breaks myth that only superstar films work on Diwali Ayushmann Khurrana's 'Thamma' scored the biggest opening of his career with Rs 25.11 crore on Diwali. The actor called it a dream-come-true moment and said the film proves audiences still value original stories.

Krishna Shroff on losing Chhoriyan Chali Gaon to Anita: It was a personal win After emerging as the runner-up of 'Chhoriyan Chali Gaon', Krishna Shroff opened up about her equation with actor Anita Hassanandani. In an exclusive conversation, Krishna also shared how the show's host, Rannvijay Singha, influenced her journey.

Anupama Parameswaran disappointed with Paradha's theatrical run: I am really sad Anupama Parameswaran addresses the underwhelming box office performance of her recent Telugu film Paradha, acknowledging her disappointment despite positive reviews and a diverse slate of film projects this year.

BB19 episode 57: Altaf Raja concert, Ashnoor jealous over Farrhana-Abhishek bond Altaf Raja's Diwali performance had Neelam, Tanya, and Malti dancing and enjoying the festive cheer in the 'Bigg Boss 19' house. Meanwhile, tensions simmered as Ashnoor grew jealous of Abhishek and Farrhana's playful interactions, and Gaurav clashed with housemates over unwashed spoons.

Bigg Boss Telugu 9 Day 44: Thanuja and Emmanuel's clash sparks house drama The October 22 episode of 'Bigg Boss Telugu 9' brought an emotional storm inside the house, with relationships tested, tempers flaring, and unexpected shifts in alliances.

Rajinikanth praises Mari Selvaraj's Bison Kaalamaadan: Your effort amazes me Superstar Rajinikanth called director Mari Selvaraj to praise his new film 'Bison Kaalamaadan'. Selvaraj shared details of the call and expressed gratitude on behalf of his team.

If Lokah was made in Telugu, people would've picked it apart, says Naga Vamsi Producer Naga Vamsi said the Malayalam superhero 'Lokah Chapter 1: Chandra', dubbed as 'Kotha Lokah', was better received in Telugu than it might have been as a native film. He also noted smaller films like 'Little Hearts' are seeing surprising success ahead of Ravi Teja's 'Mass Jathara'.

When Asrani regretted doing Sunny Leone's Mastizaade, decried vulgarity in films Veteran actor Asrani passed away on October 20 in Mumbai. In a past interview, he criticised rising vulgarity in films like 'Mastizaade' and expressed faith that Indian audiences would always value family-oriented cinema.

Actor Chitrangda Singh shares hospital update, deletes post later Actor Chitrangda Singh shared a hospital update on Instagram, assuring fans she'll be "back running like a hare soon" despite not revealing the reason for her admission. She continues to work on projects including 'Battle of Galwan' and recently starred in 'Housefull 5'.

general news.headline: First pics of cell readied for Mehul Choksi inside Mumbai's Arthur Road JailIndia has submitted photos of Mumbai's Arthur Road Jail's Barrack No 12, where fugitive jeweller Mehul Choksi will be kept after extradition, to Belgian authorities to counter his claims about poor prison conditions.

BCCI to escalate Asia Cup trophy handover issue to ICC, refuses Naqvi's suggestionBCCI plans to raise the trophy handover issue with the ICC after the ACC chief refused to comply, with discussions set for the December 4–7 board meeting in Dubai.

Because Sarfaraz is Khan? Congress's Shama Mohamed jabs Gambhir in selection rowCongress spokesperson Shama Mohamed questioned India coach Gautam Gambhir over the non-selection of Sarfaraz Khan in the recent national team assignments despite his good form in domestic cricket.

Why protest over China-backed Teesta plan in Bangladesh is a red flag for DelhiThousands in Bangladesh's Chattogram held a massive rally demanding the implementation of the China-backed Teesta River Master Plan. However, experts say the plan involving Beijing, amid stalled water-sharing talks with India, could pose strategic risks for New Delhi due to its proximity to the sensitive Siliguri Corridor.

Woman slams Taj Delhi restaurant for asking her to not sit cross-legged, posts videoIn a now-viral video, Shradha Sharma claimed that a hotel manager approached her during the meal and told her not to sit cross-legged as it was making other guests uncomfortable.

Trump has a new playlist, 'I ended India-Pakistan war' now passeModi-Trump call: Over the past week, Trump repeated four times that PM Modi assured him of halting Russian oil purchases. Surprisingly, Trump's boast about stopping the India-Pakistan conflict, which he has repeated over 50 times, has been MIA.

What's kafala that turns millions of Indians into slaves in the Gulf?The kafala system in Gulf countries enables employers to seize passports, control movement, institutionalise abuse and turn millions of migrant workers, with the largest chunk from India, into "modern-day slaves". Saudi Arabia has finally scrapped the 50-year-old setup, but several Gulf Cooperation Council countries still facilitate abuse under the kafala system.
Lucky Ali slams Javed Akhtar for 'don't become like Muslims' remarkSinger Lucky Ali has responded to Javed Akhtar after a video surfaced of Akhtar telling Hindus not to become like Muslims

All you need to know about Tata Sierra: The nostalgic SUV returns next monthTata Motors is set to revive the legendary Sierra SUV this November, blending its nostalgic 1990s charm with modern design, advanced technology, and both ICE and electric powertrain options.

Delhi hogs the attention after Diwali, but air in these cities is just as toxicDelhi pollution: Delhi recorded its worst post-Diwali air quality in the last four years on Tuesday, sparking concerns and debates among climate activists. However, the same sense of urgency or focus goes missing when it comes to other metro cities.

One injured in shooting outside Serbian Parliament, President calls it terror actMultiple gunshots were fired outside Serbia's parliament in Belgrade on Wednesday, injuring a 57-year-old man in the hip and setting ablaze a tent belonging to President Aleksandar Vucic supporters.

US likely to cut tariffs on Indian imports to 15%-16%: ReportThe proposed agreement mainly focusses on the energy and agriculture sectors. One of the key elements under discussion is India's gradual reduction of crude oil imports from Russia, a move that aligns with Washington's efforts to limit global dependence on Russian energy supplies.

Samantha Prabhu weighs 50kg, eats 100g protein. Nutritionist says it's not for allCelebrity diets can inspire, but blindly following them can backfire. Samantha Prabhu eats 100 g of protein daily at 50 kg, but Nutritionist warn it's not for everyone. Here's what average Indian women should aim for and how to meet it naturally.

Bengaluru airport staff trace Chandigarh man's lost bag using UPI transactionIn a post on X, Jaskaran Singh said that he accidentally left his bag on a Kia shuttle bus on the way to Kempegowda International Airport.

AQI units shut to hide Delhi pollution: AAP claims BJP fudging air quality dataAAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj alleged that as pollution levels started to rise on Diwali night, dozens of monitoring stations were shut down and were only restarted in the morning.

UP man turns judge with Bluffmaster, Special 26 lessons, targets divorceesUP man Vishnu Shankar Gupta, inspired by Bollywood con films like Special 26 and Bluffmaster, impersonated a judge, an IAS officer, and an IPS cop to exploit divorced and widowed women, cheating them out of lakhs of rupees. He carried out the elaborate scam with the help of his ex-wife Ayushi Gupta.

Thamma ending explained: How Betaal vs Betaal fight sets the stage for greater warAyushmann Khurrana's 'Thamma' ends with a fierce Betaal vs Betaal showdown, something the trailer had also teased. But the final twist hints at a much larger conflict brewing within Maddock's horror-comedy universe.

Medical college seats are at a record high. So why is competition still so hard?Despite a record expansion in medical seats in 2025 which lifted the total above 1.3 lakhs, NEET applicants still outnumber MBBS seats by roughly 20:1. Government medical seats are prized and private fees are steep, making medical competition absolutely brutal — unlike engineering, where far more seats and multiple exams make admissions comparatively easier.

Curious case of RRP Semiconductor: The stock that gained 63,000% in 18 monthsRRP Semiconductor's stock soared from Rs 15 to Rs 9,478 in just 18 months, stunning Dalal Street. But do the company's financials really justify this meteoric rise?

Pakistan has egg on face as Imperial College London busts Lahore campus claimsThe Punjab government of Pakistan announced a new campus of London's Imperial College campus in Lahore. However, the UK university quickly denied the claim, saying it had "no such plans". The fake claim by the Maryam Nawaz-led provincial government, which she herself amplified, sparked criticism from an alumnus of the Imperial College, who slammed the government.

Video: Staff pushes President's chopper after it sinks into new helipadPresident Droupadi Murmu's helicopter wheels got stuck in depressions on a freshly concreted helipad at Pramadam. The incident occurred as she landed in Kerala for her Sabarimala visit.

China's Chang'e-6 discovers unique relics buried on the MoonThe Chang'e-6 mission collected nearly two kilograms of soil from the Moon's South Pole-Aitken Basin, the largest and oldest known impact crater on the lunar far side.

Can going cash-only (and ditching UPI) help you save money?Is taking a break from UPI apps and going cash-only to curb unnecessary spending and save money a good idea? Finance experts have a lot to say.

Video: BJP leader forces man to apologise, rub nose on road in police presenceThe incident reportedly took place on October 19 at Tez Garhi Chowraha in the Medical police station area. It began as a minor parking dispute between Vikul Chaprana and two youths whose car was parked near the Energy State Minister Dr Somendra Tomar's office.

Ayushmann Khurrana offers prayers at Siddhivinayak after Thamma's Diwali successAyushmann Khurrana visited Mumbai's Siddhivinayak Temple to seek blessings after his film 'Thamma' emerged as a major hit in the Maddock horror-comedy universe. The film's unique love story and strong cast have struck a chord with audiences, marking a big win for both the actor and the franchise.

sports.headline: Harbhajan Singh, Piyush Chawla headline big names list for Abu Dhabi T10 2025 Harbhajan Singh, Piyush Chawla and S. Sreesanth are among the big names who have signed up for the 2025 edition of the Abu Dhabi T10 League. The new season will two debutant teams battle it out for the title.

BCCI to escalate Asia Cup trophy handover issue to ICC, refuses Naqvi's suggestion BCCI plans to raise the trophy handover issue with the ICC after the ACC chief refused to comply, with discussions set for the December 4–7 board meeting in Dubai.

Kagiso Rabada hits 71, scripts South African record in Rawalpindi Test PAK vs SA, 2nd Test: Kagiso Rabada scored his maiden Test fifty with a record 71 runs as South Africa took a first innings lead of 71 runs. The South African No. 11 tore into Pakistan's bowling attack on Day 3 in Rawalpindi.

WPL 2026 auction set to take place in New Delhi on November 26-27 window: Reports The Women's Premier League (WPL) auction is set for New Delhi on November 26-27, with franchises allowed to retain up to five players under revised rules, including the RTM option.

Asia Cup Trophy Standoff: ACC To Return India's Asia Cup Trophy After Pak's Naqvi 'Ran Away' With It A major controversy has erupted between the BCCI and the Asian Cricket Council (ACC) over the Asia Cup 2025 trophy, involving ACC President Mohsin Naqvi. The BCCI has demanded an explanation stating, 'how and why the awards were withheld at the venue, and on what authority the ACC President took possession of them'. After the Indian team, led by Suryakumar Yadav, refused to accept the trophy from Naqvi following their victory over Pakistan, the ACC chief reportedly took the silverware. The ACC has now proposed a formal handover ceremony in Dubai on November 10, an invitation India is unlikely to accept. The BCCI has warned that the matter will be escalated to the ICC next month if the trophy is not returned.

Gyokeres makes Arsenal a better team: Arteta praises striker after Atleti win Mikel Arteta heaped praise on Viktor Gyokeres for breaking his goal drought for Arsenal after their win over Atletico Madrid. Gyokeres scored a brace as the Gunners thumped Atleti 4-0 on Tuesday, October 21.

2nd ODI Preview: Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma face litmus test in Adelaide India vs Australia: India have travelled to Adelaide to play their second ODI of the series. Will Virat Kohli step up in his favourite hunting ground with series on the line?

Cong Neta Links Sarfaraz Khan's Snub To Religion; Slams Coach Gambhir A massive controversy has erupted over the non-selection of cricketer Sarfaraz Khan, with Congress leader Shama Mohammed alleging religious bias. In her statement, Mohammed questioned if Sarfaraz was sidelined due to his surname, stating, 'Sarfaraz was left out due to his surname?'. The debate intensified as she also pointed fingers at India's head coach, Gautam Gambhir. The programme explores the political firestorm, featuring arguments from AIMIM's Waris Pathan, who highlighted Khan's exceptional domestic record and fitness improvements. Countering the allegations, former UP Minister Mohsin Raza condemned the politicization of cricket, reminding critics of India's history of Muslim captains and players. The discussion delves into whether Khan's exclusion is a matter of cricketing logic, as suggested by some, or a case of discrimination as alleged by opposition figures.

Mohsin Naqvi orders review after Pakistan flops in Women's World Cup: Report PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi has ordered a review of the Pakistan team's performance in the Women's World Cup 2025. Pakistan remains winless in the tournament and were knocked out of the running for the semi-finals after their loss to South Africa on October 21.

2nd ODI Preview: Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma face litmus test in Adelaide India vs Australia: India have travelled to Adelaide to play their second ODI of the series. Will Virat Kohli step up in his favourite hunting ground with series on the line?

In her statement, Mohammed questioned if Sarfaraz was sidelined due to his surname, stating, 'Sarfaraz was left out due to his surname?'. The debate intensified as she also pointed fingers at India's head coach, Gautam Gambhir. The programme explores the political firestorm, featuring arguments from AIMIM's Waris Pathan, who highlighted Khan's exceptional domestic record and fitness improvements. Countering the allegations, former UP Minister Mohsin Raza condemned the politicization of cricket, reminding critics of India's history of Muslim captains and players. The discussion delves into whether Khan's exclusion is a matter of cricketing logic, as suggested by some, or a case of discrimination as alleged by opposition figures.

Mohsin Naqvi orders review after Pakistan flops in Women's World Cup: Report PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi has ordered a review of the Pakistan team's performance in the Women's World Cup 2025. Pakistan remains winless in the tournament and were knocked out of the running for the semi-finals after their loss to South Africa on October 21.

Lt Col Neeraj Chopra officially pipped, receives rank in special ceremonyOlympic champion Neeraj Chopra was officially presented with the honorary rank of Lieutenant Colonel in the Territorial Army. The ceremony in New Delhi, attended by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, recognised his achievements in athletics.

AUS vs IND: Virat Kohli chases history as India look to retaliate in Adelaide ODIAUS vs IND, 2nd ODI: Virat Kohli is 25 runs away from becoming the first visiting batter to score 1000 runs at the Adelaide Oval when India and Australia lock horns at the venue on Thursday.

FC Goa vs Al Nassr FC: When and where to watch AFC Champions League 2 clashAl Nassr will be aiming to keep their winning momentum going in the AFC Champions League 2 as they take on FC Goa in Fatorda. The Indian side has lost their first two games in the tournament.

Because Sarfaraz is Khan? Congress's Shama Mohamed jabs Gambhir in selection rowCongress spokesperson Shama Mohamed questioned India coach Gautam Gambhir over the non-selection of Sarfaraz Khan in the recent national team assignments despite his good form in domestic cricket.

The bulldog in Shubman Gill comes out when team needs him most: Ricky PontingRicky Ponting said that he has been impressed by Shubman Gill's captaincy so far ahead of the second ODI between Australia and India. Gill was made captain earlier in the year and is tipped to be the skipper for India in all three formats soon.

Pakistan's Asif Afridi, 38, becomes oldest to take 5-wicket haul on Test debutPakistan vs South Africa: 38-year-old Asif Afridi became the oldest bowler to take a five-wicket haul on Test debut. The left-arm spinner ran through South Africa's middle-order on Days 2 and 3 of the Rawalpindi Test.

Hattrick hero Fermin hails perfect El Clasico prep after Barca rout OlympiacosFC Barcelona routed Olympiacos in the Champions League. Fermin Lopez hit his maiden hattrick for the club as they capped off a perfect game ahead of El Clasico on Sunday, October 26.

Virat Kohli inspires even in failure: How Perth duck calmed Aussie debutant's nerveIndia tour of Australia: Virat Kohli's rare failure in Perth turned into a source of calm for Australian debutant Matt Renshaw. As nerves crept in before his first ODI innings, seeing the Indian maestro fall for a duck reminded Renshaw that even the greats have off days – and that failure is part of the game.

The bulldog in Shubman Gill comes out when team needs him most: Ricky PontingRicky Ponting said that he has been impressed by Shubman Gill's captaincy so far ahead of the second ODI between Australia and India. Gill was made captain earlier in the year and is tipped to be the skipper for India in all three formats soon.

Pakistan's Asif Afridi, 38, becomes oldest to take 5-wicket haul on Test debutPakistan vs South Africa: 38-year-old Asif Afridi became the oldest bowler to take a five-wicket haul on Test debut. The left-arm spinner ran through South Africa's middle-order on Days 2 and 3 of the Rawalpindi Test.

Hattrick hero Fermin hails perfect El Clasico prep after Barca rout OlympiacosFC Barcelona routed Olympiacos in the Champions League. Fermin Lopez hit his maiden hattrick for the club as they capped off a perfect game ahead of El Clasico on Sunday, October 26.

Virat Kohli inspires even in failure: How Perth duck calmed Aussie debutant's nerveIndia tour of Australia: Virat Kohli's rare failure in Perth turned into a source of calm for Australian debutant Matt Renshaw. As nerves crept in before his first ODI innings, seeing the Indian maestro fall for a duck reminded Renshaw that even the greats have off days – and that failure is part of the game.

Virat-Rohit get thumbs up from Sitanshu Kotak ahead of Adelaide ODIIndia vs Australia: India batting coach Sitanshu Kotak has given the vote of confidence to Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma ahead of the 2nd ODI clash of the series. Kotak said that both batted well in the nets.

LaLiga cancels Barcelona's match in Miami after severe backlash from fansLaLiga has cancelled Barcelona's match against Villarreal, which was scheduled to take place in Miami. The move came against immense backlash from fans and pundits who complained about the disruption of schedule.

Asia Cup Trophy War: Pak Minister Naqvi Refuses to Hand Over Prize to India, BCCI Warns ICC ActionThis special report focuses on the continuing deadlock over the Asia Cup 2025 trophy between the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) and Asian Cricket Council (ACC) President Mohsin Naqvi. The controversy ignited after Naqvi, who is also Pakistan's Interior Minister and PCB Chairman, refused to part with the trophy, instead urging 'that there be a presentation ceremony at which a BCCI officer, office bearer that is, and a participating player of the Indian team collect the trophy directly from him'. The demand came in response to a stern letter from the BCCI asking for the trophy to be sent to India. Following the refusal, the BCCI has warned it will escalate the matter to the International Cricket Council (ICC) if the trophy is not handed over.

Would be 5000 runs past Sachin Tendulkar had I debuted early: Michael HusseyFormer Australia cricketer Michael Hussey believes that he would have crossed Sachin Tendulkar if he had debuted earlier in international cricket. Hussey, lovingly known as Mr. Cricket debuted for Australia at the age of 28.

Polo, family, and an Olympic dream: Inside Lance Watson's remarkable journeyA third-generation polo player and one of the shining stars of the legendary Jaipur polo team, Lance Watson opens up about his journey in the sport, his love for India, and the Olympic dream he sees alongside his kids.

Rohit-Kohli not rusty, no need to jump the gun on them: Sitanshu KotakIndia batting coach Sitanshu Kotak believes that there is no need to jump the gun on Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. Speaking ahead of the 2nd ODI against Australia, Kotak called for patience with the senior duo.

Is Harshit Rana criticised for clicks or is the scrutiny warranted?Harshit Rana's selection has sparked debate, balancing performance, perception, and patronage. At 23, he's a promising pacer in a thin Indian fast-bowling pool. Criticism is fair, but noise and nepotism claims risk overshadowing his potential.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
